alert.note: Alert for Cascade; Judith Basin (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 5:59PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Judith Basin and east central Cascade Counties through 645 PM MDT... At 559 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 18 miles southwest of Geyser, or 24 miles west of Stanford, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Monarch. This includes the following highways... Highway 200 between mile markers 12 and 29. Highway 89 between mile markers 40 and 52. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for central Montana.
